member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateCompositeAddressLocator
member.summary: Creates a composite address locator. A composite address locator consists of two or more individual address locators that allow addresses to be matched against the multiple address locators.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateCompositeAddressLocator.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The order of the participating address locators determines how candidates are searched and an address is matched. When you geocode a single address, the address will be matched against all participating address locators unless the locator is specified with a selection criterion. All the found candidates will be displayed based on the order of the listed participating address locators. If you geocode a table of addresses, addresses are matched automatically to the first best candidate found from the first participating address locators. If the address fails to match, it will fall back to the subsequent locator in the list. (In, Required)
The mapping of input fields used by each participating address locator to the input fields of the composite address locator. (In, Required)
The composite address locator to create. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateCompositeAddressLocator.in_address_locators
member.summary: The order of the participating address locators determines how candidates are searched and an address is matched. When you geocode a single address, the address will be matched against all participating address locators unless the locator is specified with a selection criterion. All the found candidates will be displayed based on the order of the listed participating address locators. If you geocode a table of addresses, addresses are matched automatically to the first best candidate found from the first participating address locators. If the address fails to match, it will fall back to the subsequent locator in the list. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateCompositeAddressLocator.in_field_map
member.summary: The mapping of input fields used by each participating address locator to the input fields of the composite address locator. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateCompositeAddressLocator.in_selection_criteria
member.summary: Selection criteria for each participating address locator. Only one selection criterion is supported for each participating address locator. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateCompositeAddressLocator.out_composite_address_locator
member.summary: The composite address locator to create. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateAddressLocator
member.summary: Creates an address locator. The address locator can be used to find a location of an address, geocode a table of addresses, or get the address of a point location.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateAddressLocator.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The address locator style on which to base the new address locator. (In, Required)
The reference data feature classes and tables to be used by the address locator, along with their roles. (In, Required)
The mapping of reference data fields used by the address locator style to fields in the reference datasets. Each field mapping in this parameter is in the format: (In, Required)

The address locator to create. Saving the locator to a file folder allows you to take advantage of performance improvements, multithreading capabilities, and suggestions support. Once the locator is created, additional properties and options can be modified in the locator's settings. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateAddressLocator.in_address_locator_style
member.summary: The address locator style on which to base the new address locator. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateAddressLocator.in_reference_data
member.summary: The reference data feature classes and tables to be used by the address locator, along with their roles. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateAddressLocator.in_field_map
member.summary: The mapping of reference data fields used by the address locator style to fields in the reference datasets. Each field mapping in this parameter is in the format: (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateAddressLocator.out_address_locator
member.summary: The address locator to create. Saving the locator to a file folder allows you to take advantage of performance improvements, multithreading capabilities, and suggestions support. Once the locator is created, additional properties and options can be modified in the locator's settings. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateAddressLocator.config_keyword
member.summary: The configuration keyword that determines the storage parameters of the table in a Relational Database Management System (RDBMS)â€”enterprise and file geodatabases only. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.CreateAddressLocator.enable_suggestions
member.summary: Allows character-by-character auto-complete suggestions to be generated for user input in a client application. This capability facilitates the interactive search user experience by reducing the number of characters that need to be typed before a suggested match is obtained. The idea is that a client application can provide a list of suggestions which is updated with each character entered by a user until the place they are looking for is returned in the list. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.GeocodeAddresses
member.summary: Geocodes a table of addresses. This process requires a table that stores the addresses you want to geocode and an address locator or a composite address locator. This tool matches the addresses against the address locator and saves the result for each input record in a new point feature class. When using the ArcGIS World Geocoding Service, this operation may consume credits.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.GeocodeAddresses.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The table of addresses to geocode. (In, Required)

The address locator to use to geocode the table of addresses.
Locators should be stored in a file folder so you take advantage of new features that are not supported for locators stored in geodatabases, such as performance improvements, multithreading capabilities, and suggestions support. ArcGIS 10.4 is the last release to support storing locators in geodatabases. (In, Required)

Each field mapping in this parameter is in the format input_address_field, table_field_name where input_address_field is the name of the input address field specified by the address locator, and table_field_name is the name of the corresponding field in the table of addresses you want to geocode. (In, Required)
The output geocoded feature class or shapefile. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.GeocodeAddresses.in_table
member.summary: The table of addresses to geocode. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.GeocodeAddresses.address_locator
member.summary:
The address locator to use to geocode the table of addresses.
Locators should be stored in a file folder so you take advantage of new features that are not supported for locators stored in geodatabases, such as performance improvements, multithreading capabilities, and suggestions support. ArcGIS 10.4 is the last release to support storing locators in geodatabases. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.GeocodeAddresses.in_address_fields
member.summary: Each field mapping in this parameter is in the format input_address_field, table_field_name where input_address_field is the name of the input address field specified by the address locator, and table_field_name is the name of the corresponding field in the table of addresses you want to geocode. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.GeocodeAddresses.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output geocoded feature class or shapefile. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.GeocodeAddresses.out_relationship_type
member.summary: Indicates whether to create a static copy of the address table inside the geocoded feature class or to create a dynamically updated geocoded feature class. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.GeocodeAddresses.country
member.summary: Geocoding will be limited to the selected countries. When no country is used, geocoding will be performed against all supported countries. Making a country selection will improve the accuracy of geocoding in most cases. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.GeocodeAddresses.location_type
member.summary: Specifies the preferred output geometry for PointAddress matches. The options are the street side location, which can be used for routing, or the rooftop or parcel centroid for the address. If the preferred location does not exist in the data, the default location will be returned instead. For geocode results where Addr_type=PointAddress, the X,Y attribute values describe the coordinates of the address along the street, while the DisplayX and DisplayY values describe the rooftop, or building centroid, coordinates. See the REST API web help for more details about the locationType parameter for geocodeAddresses. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.RebuildAddressLocator
member.summary: Rebuilds an address locator to update the locator with the current reference data. Since an address locator contains a snapshot of the reference data when it was created, it will not geocode addresses against the updated data when the geometry and attributes of the reference data are changed. To geocode addresses against the current version of the reference data, the address locator must be rebuilt if you want to update the changes in the locator.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.RebuildAddressLocator.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The address locator to rebuild. (In, Required)

member.summary: The address locator to rebuild. (In, Required)

member.summary: Output Address Locator (out, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.ReverseGeocode
member.summary: Creates addresses from point locations in a feature class. The reverse geocoding process searches for the nearest address or intersection for the point location based on the specified search distance. When using the ArcGIS World Geocoding Service, this operation may consume credits.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.ReverseGeocode.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: A point feature class or layer from which addresses are returned based on the features' point location. (In, Required)

The address locator to use to reverse geocode the input feature class.
Locators should be stored in a file folder so you take advantage of new features that are not supported for locators stored in geodatabases, such as performance improvements, multithreading capabilities, and suggestions support. ArcGIS 10.4 is the last release to support storing locators in geodatabases. (In, Required)
The output feature class. (Out, Required)

The distance used to search for the nearest address or intersection for the point location. Some locators use optimized distance values that do not support overriding the search distance parameter. The default search distance for classic locators is100m. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.ReverseGeocode.in_features
member.summary: A point feature class or layer from which addresses are returned based on the features' point location. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.ReverseGeocode.in_address_locator
member.summary:
The address locator to use to reverse geocode the input feature class.
Locators should be stored in a file folder so you take advantage of new features that are not supported for locators stored in geodatabases, such as performance improvements, multithreading capabilities, and suggestions support. ArcGIS 10.4 is the last release to support storing locators in geodatabases. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.ReverseGeocode.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.ReverseGeocode.address_type
member.summary: Specifies whether to return addresses for the points as street addresses or intersection addresses if the address locator supports intersection matching. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.ReverseGeocode.search_distance
member.summary: The distance used to search for the nearest address or intersection for the point location. Some locators use optimized distance values that do not support overriding the search distance parameter. The default search distance for classic locators is100m. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.ReverseGeocode.feature_type
member.summary: Limits the possible match types returned. Single or multiple values can be selected. If a single value is selected, the search tolerance for the input feature type is 500 meters. If multiple values are included, the default search distances specified in the feature type hierarchy table are applied. See the REST API web help for more details about the featureTypes parameter for reverseGeocode. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.ReverseGeocode.location_type
member.summary: This parameter is available for locators that support the locationType parameter. It specifies the preferred output geometry for PointAddress matches. The options for this parameter are a side-of-street location that can be used for routing, or the location that represents the rooftop or parcel centroid for the address. If the preferred location does not exist in the data, the default location will be returned instead. For geocode results with Addr_type=PointAddress, the X,Y attribute values describe the coordinates of the address along the street, while the DisplayX and DisplayY values describe the rooftop, or building centroid, coordinates. See the REST API web help for more details about the locationType parameter for reverseGeocode. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeocodingTools.ReverseGeocode.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.
